name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"611d9cce-9634-4a1b-8829-f3b2e2fc0901","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Class Documentation: ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"NamePointer","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"04a8080d-1324-444f-945d-b1ac0bc24169","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"NamePointer","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class is a sophisticated specialized pointer designed to model the complexity of function calls. Unlike a basic pointer that tracks a single variable's values, a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"NamePointer","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" acts as a container for an entire set of arguments. It manages the translation between how arguments are passed (either by their position in a list or by a specific keyword name) and how they are received by a function's parameters.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"05d82a8f-a8df-4208-8d5b-a063dfcb1c08","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"353ea399-6e60-4e01-b168-222b150e3268","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Attributes","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4d0fc1e3-53a6-4af8-a4fc-db4d412ca4bc","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"pos_to_name","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"dict","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"): Maps integer call positions (0, 1, 2...) to parameter names.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"685f0fc5-2fd1-4769-9f19-e451e41c0905","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"name_to_pos","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"dict","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"): The reverse mapping of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pos_to_name","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", linking parameter names back to their original positions.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d6a64a16-2748-49c5-bc5b-e32d17c10d64","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"args","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"dict","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"): The core data storage. Keys are argument names, and values are ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"set","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" objects containing all potential values or definitions for that argument.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cb53d83a-9b56-42dc-a101-e90816894eea","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"924d55de-bf6f-4b2d-90a2-9b6aecc398b0","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Logic Groups","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4e2517f5-606a-4f2a-96ba-ae1503774454","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Argument Registration & Data Entry
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"These methods are used during the analysis of a call site (the place where a function is invoked). They populate the pointer with data, handling the conversion of raw literals and the binding of positional data to identifiers.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ca03f480-93a9-47c0-a8d1-a94f542d11a1","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key Methods","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":": ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"add_arg","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"add_lit_arg","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"add_pos_arg","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"add_name_arg","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"add_pos_lit_arg","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d3e663a4-973c-4b6b-b750-060f4c7ce75b","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Retrieval & Inspection
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"These methods allow the engine to "read" the collected arguments. This is typically used when the analyzer moves inside a function body and needs to map the calling values to the function's local parameters.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7d324849-b063-4191-9315-459e7a3b803e","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key Methods","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":": ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_arg","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_pos_arg","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_args","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_pos_args","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_pos_of_name","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_pos_names","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8185ee40-2b94-40cd-98b7-0fe295688bb2","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Internal Management & State
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Infrastructure methods that handle the initialization of the object, validation of positional indices, and the logic for merging two different call signatures into one.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"001018fb-768f-4775-8112-e18d783b6f18","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key Methods","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":": ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"_sanitize_pos","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__init__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_or_create","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"merge","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"888666a6-3e30-49ea-b0cb-73c168e9a66e","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"4607b8c7-9e59-4b36-9e17-0c427ef76b01","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Usage Example","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"141bc84a-1164-44fb-8a48-435b06ee5f2c","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"In this example, we simulate the analysis of a function call ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"connect("localhost", port=8080)","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c182a2b6-9276-4d07-bc8f-d7356cfdb5eb","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"from pointers import NamePointer

# 1. Initialize the pointer for a new function call
call_pointer = NamePointer()

# 2. Add a positional argument (Position 0 is the "host")
call_pointer.add_pos_arg(pos=0, name="host", item="server_v1")

# 3. Add a named literal argument
call_pointer.add_lit_arg(name="port", item=8080)

# 4. Retrieval during function body analysis
# The analyzer knows the first parameter of connect() is 'host'
host_potential_values = call_pointer.get_arg("host")
print(f"Host points to: {host_potential_values}") 
# Output: Host points to: {'server_v1'}

# 5. Check literal normalization for the port
port_data = call_pointer.get_arg("port")
print(f"Port data: {port_data}") 
# Output: Port data: {'INTEGER'}","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9ef899b2-a007-4fb7-a941-8b1c63018642","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Insights","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ba8cca6d-b000-49e5-acd7-6c9d9bd09e7b","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Call-Site Flexibility","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By maintaining both ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pos_to_name","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"name_to_pos","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"NamePointer","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can resolve arguments even if the function signature is only partially known at the time of the call.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"179c54a7-1a92-47ce-8886-aa9775ca2fd2","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Structural Merging","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"merge","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method is vital for inter-procedural analysis. If a function is called from two different locations with different arguments, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"merge","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" allows the analyzer to see the union of all possible argument values when analyzing the target function.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e81a12b6-f9e7-42b2-98dd-febb4069334a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Constraint Enforcement","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": Through ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"_sanitize_pos","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the class ensures that positional indices are always integers, preventing the accidental corruption of the mapping logic during complex analysis passes.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"24c56af2-b835-414b-ad23-ec964255214a","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
